title: Makha Bucha day Events
description: Located in Wimbledon, this is the most famous Thai temple in the UK. They host a major candlelight procession (Wian Tian) around their traditional Thai-style chapel.-One of the most famous Thai temples in Europe. Expect morning alms giving, meditation, and a beautiful evening candlelight procession around the ornate Thai-style chapel.

title: Makha Bucha day-Wat Phra Singh UK
description: A very active temple in Runcorn that organizes large-scale merit-making events and recently completed a "Peace Garden" for such ceremonies.-A northern UK hub that holds regular lunar calendar festivals, including Dhamma talks and community lunch offerings.

title: Makha Bucha day -Wat Thammapathip
description: Set in a beautiful historic chateau, this temple serves as a central hub for the Thai community in France and holds large-scale outdoor chanting and candlelight walks.-Located in a historic chateau, this temple hosts large gatherings with traditional Thai food stalls, merit-making, and evening chanting.

title: Makha Bucha day -Wat Srinagarindrawararam
description: One of the most significant Thai temples in Europe, built in honor of the Princess Mother of Thailand. It is a major site for formal Makha Bucha ceremonies.-Built to honor the Princess Mother of Thailand, this temple is a hub for the Swiss-Thai community and holds formal ceremonies with local monks.

title: Makha Bucha day- Wat Buddhavihara
description: Hosts a traditional Wian Tian (candlelight walk). It is a central point for Buddhists in Northeast Germany to gather for sermons and merit-making.-Known for its strong community engagement, they host traditional sermons and a candlelit walk around their main hall.-Hosts a traditional Wian Tian (candlelight walk). It is a central point for Buddhists in Northeast Germany to gather for sermons and merit-making.

title: Makha Bucha day- Wat Thai Budapest Budapest
description: A smaller but very active community temple that organizes traditional ceremonies for the local expat and devotee population.

title: Thailand Showcase 2025 London
description: A massive free festival celebrating 170 years of Thai-UK relations. Expect street food, traditional performances, and even raffle prizes like flights to Thailand.

title: Magic of Thailand Festival 2025
description: A ticketed event (£6) featuring a "Thai Beer Garden," food stalls, and a live replica of a Thai night market.

title: Thai Garden Festival 2025
description: Over 60 exhibitors, authentic street food, and a "Wellness Zone" for traditional massages.
